problem_text: a) For a finite group X, let χ1(X) denote the totality of the degrees of all irreducible complex characters of X with allowance for their multiplicities. Suppose that χ1(G) = χ1(H) for groups G and H. Clearly, then |G| = |H|. Is it true that H is simple if G is simple? Ya. G. Berkovich
answer: a) Yes, it is (H. P. Tong-Viet, J. Algebra, 357 (2012), 61–68; Monatsh. Math., 166, no. 3–4 (2012), 559–577; Algebr. Represent. Theory, 15, no. 2 (2012), 379–389).
